intro: Solidago randii, commonly known as the mountain goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Solidago randii is often found in alpine meadows and is a key component of the local flora in its native range.
